__e: And it matters more to you than anything mattered to me.
You know, it's like... nobody really cared about her when she was alive, and... now nobody really cares that she's dead, so...
It just didn't seem to matter to anyone that I was... I was the brains, but you know I was the brains behind...
I was sort of saying that I didn't mind if you didn't want to see me again.
What did it matter if my mommy was mean to me or what I saw when I was you.
But the last time I was saying that it wouldn't have mattered if my father had seen the other people on board that flight.
And he did not care what you do in life?
What happened to the girl who didn't care what people thought about her?
It's just that it seemed like no matter what I did for you, it was never enough, or it wasn't right, or...
It's just that it seemed like no matter what I did for you, it was never enough, or it wasn't right, or...
What happened to the girl who didn't care what people thought about her?
Well, at least he knew that there was someone who cared enough about him to check up on him.
All he cared about was the bloody car - bet it was the same when she was alive as well.
All I cared about was getting out and moving again...
I told myself I was all about the mind.
Before, I couldn't handle being alone, no matter how bad things got.
I told myself a long time ago it wouldn't matter, that I'm his father.
I realized that was what mattered, that things were fine as they were.
I thought you cared about family, but you clearly don't.
Yeah, you said you didn't care for the woman who used to work here.
